forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog. Mostly clear, with a low around 50. West wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog before 7am. Sunny, with a high near 77. Southwest wind 2 to 6 mph.

weather_report:
As the early hours of the morning envelop Boston, a gentle patch of fog settles quietly, weaving through the spaces between the buildings like an elusive ghost. Tonight, the air is cool and tranquil with a low resting comfortably around 50 degrees. A soft west wind whispers through the streets, inviting those awake to savor the stillness before dawn breaks.

As the sun rises tomorrow, the fog will lift to unveil a brilliant morning. Anticipate clear skies adorned with sunshine, warming the city as it reaches towards 77 degrees. A gentle southwest breeze will accompany the day, creating a pleasant ambiance for anyone ready to venture outdoors. Given these conditions, one might choose to dress in light, breathable layers—a simple t-shirt or a comfortable blouse, complemented by shorts or lightweight trousers—perfect for exploring the local parks or enjoying a café terrace. With the cheerful weather beckoning, perhaps a leisurely stroll along the Charles River or a visit to the Arnold Arboretum would be just right, allowing one to relish the beauty of the season and the vitality of the city.
